videos.title: Let The Floor Support You
videos.description: Adjust your chair height so your feet rest flat and even on the floor to support you.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: A Tip For Working On Your Couch
videos.description: Sit on your couch or bed? It is probably too deep and your pelvis rolls back, collapsing your spine. Put some cushions in your back and let them keep your pelvis upright.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 3 Tips To Adjust Your Monitor Sitting
videos.description: The monitor off to the side, too high or too low, twists your spine causing lower back and neck pain.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 3 Tips To Adjust Your Monitor Standing
videos.description: The monitor off to the side, too high or too low, twists your spine causing lower back and neck pain.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 3 Tips To Position Your Keyboard Sitting
videos.description: The keyboard off to the side twists your spine causing lower back and neck pain. Too high raises your arms. Too far pulls you forward or sends your arms forward.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 3 Tips To Adjust Your Keyboard Standing
videos.description: The keyboard off to the side twists your spine causing lower back and neck pain. Too high raises your arms. Too far pulls you forward or sends your arms forward.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 5 Tips What Not To Do With Your Keyboard
videos.description: The keyboard off to the side twists your spine causing lower back and neck pain. Too high raises your arms. Too far pulls you forward or sends your arms forward.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: Biggest Tip To Sitting Well - Keep Your Pelvis Upright
videos.description: If the foundation is off, everything is off. So, push your butt all the way back into the seat. Keep your pelvis (hip) upright, almost tilted forward and stack your spine on top in balance.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: Your Head Is Heavy But Can Be Light Sitting
videos.description: Like your arms, if you hold your head out in front of your spine, it gets very heavy and tightens your neck muscles.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: Detailed View Of Setting Your Pelvis Sitting
videos.description: Set your foundation right. Again, push your butt all the way back into the seat. Keep your pelvis (hip) upright, almost tilted forward. Stack your spine on top. Be in balance.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 4 Tips To Sitting Relaxed in Your Bones
videos.description: If you sit on your upright pelvis and stack your spine you can actually just roll your shoulders, drop your chest and relax.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 3 Things To Avoid When Sitting
videos.description: Try to sit with shoulders back as you might think you have to. How long can you do that until you collapse. Sit on the back of your pelvis and feel how your spine rounds and compresses your disks (between your vertebrae. DON'T DO IT.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 4 Things To Avoid When Sitting
videos.description: Don't sit where your muscles have to hold up your body. Let the bones do the work. It all starts with your pelvis staying upright.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: What Are You Doing With Your Arms
videos.description: Try to hold your arms out in front of you for a while. Exhausting, right? Let them hang straight from your shoulders and lift your forearms to type.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: The 2 Only Ways to Keep Your Legs Relaxed
videos.description: It is easy. If you can see both your ankles, your legs are aligned and can relax without being stressed.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 6 Examples What Not To Do with Your Legs Sitting
videos.description: If you cross your legs, sit on your foot, etc. you bend and twist your leg, knee, ankle, hip joint for hours. It will change the way you walk, run, perform. Hint - You can't see both your ankles.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 5 Tips For Your Hands
videos.description: Keep your hands and fingers cupped (slightly rounded) and your wrist straight. Don't tilt your hands up. Try to tilt your hand up and wiggle your fingers, it is exhausting.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: Watch Your Head and Upper Body
videos.description: Pull your chin to your Adam's apple and your ears over your shoulders.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: The 5 Steps To Standing Tall and Relaxed
videos.description: Yes you can stand unhealthy. How to get your hips over your heels, weight in your heels: bend forward until you see your full ankles, unlock your knees. Shake your quads. They are relaxed now. Keep your hips where they are and raise your upper body. Check if you can still see your ankles. It will feel like you are bending forward like a ski jumper, but your are not.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 4 Things To Avoid With Your Upper Body When Standing
videos.description: We used a muscle tone measuring EMG suit. And it's true. If you are not aligned, off to one side, bend forward, etc. you stress and harden your muscles.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 5 Things Not To Do Standing
videos.description: Yes you can stand badly. If your hip is hanging forward or your legs are crossed, you harden your quads and wear out your hip joints.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: How To Relax Your Legs Standing
videos.description: Standing well and relaxed. Move your hips back, plant your feet evenly, unlock your knees and stack your spine over your pelvis and you can feel that your quads are loose and relaxed.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 2 Tips For Your Upper Body Relaxation Standing
videos.description: If you stand with your hips back, weight in your heels and stack your spine - you can actually just roll your shoulders, drop your chest and relax into your bones.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: 4 Things Not To Do With Your Upper Body Standing
videos.description: If you stand with your hips back, weight in your heels and stack your spine - you can actually just roll your shoulders, drop your chest and relax into your bones.
videos.author: Brightday LLC

videos.title: Head Position Standing
videos.description: Pull your chin to your Adam's apple and your ears over your shoulders.
videos.author: Brightday LLC
